title: ‚ÄòWhy does Rahul hate those who speak for India?‚Äô BJP slams Cong for excluding Tharoor
content: Following the announcement of an all-party delegation to address Pakistan-sponsored terrorism, BJP criticized Congress for omitting Shashi Tharoor from their initial list. BJP leaders accused Rahul Gandhi of disliking party members who support India's position. The controversy arose after Congress proposed names like Syed Naseer Hussain, whose supporter allegedly raised pro-Pakistan slogans, sparking further debate.

title: 'Bharat has done it': Dhankhar likens Op Sindoor to Osama killing in Pakistan
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar lauded Operation Sindoor as India's most profound cross-border strike against terrorism, drawing parallels to the US operation that eliminated Osama bin Laden. He emphasized the precision of the strikes, targeting Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba strongholds across the International Border. This operation followed the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, prompting a firm response from Prime Minister Modi.

title: Air ambulance crashes while landing at Kedarnath, narrow escape for pilot
content: An air ambulance encountered an accident near the Kedarnath helipad around 11:50 am on Saturday when its tail struck the ground during landing. The incident occurred as the pilot attempted to land in an open field due to technical difficulties at the helipad. Fortunately, the pilot, doctor, and nursing staff escaped without injuries, and the DGCA will investigate the mishap.

title: Chinese leader refers to Mount Everest as ‚ÄòChomolungma‚Äô 10 times at Nepal forum
content: During the Sagarmatha Sambaad in Nepal, China's Vice Chairman Xiao Jie repeatedly referred to Mount Everest as "Chomolungma," the Chinese name, while other participants used English and Nepali designations. Despite Prime Minister Oli's advocacy for "Sagarmatha," he remained silent on Xiao Jie's terminology. The event, attended by international delegations and organizations, highlighted differing perspectives on the iconic peak's naming.

title: Indian-origin man slammed for calling to send H-1B holders back
content: An Indian-origin man in the US, Rohit Joy, sparked controversy by suggesting the termination of the H-1B visa program and the return of its holders to their home countries. This proposal came in response to Congressman Dr. Rich McCormick's advocacy for domestic visa renewals.

title: 'People are starving,' says Trump as Israeli strikes kill over 250 in Gaza in two days
content: Amid escalating violence, Israeli strikes in Gaza have resulted in over 250 deaths since Thursday, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian crisis. Despite international appeals for a ceasefire, Israel continues its military operations, while a prolonged blockade has led to severe shortages of food, fuel, and medical supplies, pushing Gaza towards famine.

title: Tharoor chosen to lead all-party delegation despite name missing from Congress list
content: Amidst political dynamics, Congress nominated four leaders for an all-party delegation, excluding Shashi Tharoor, despite his selection to lead the Operation Sindoor briefing. Jairam Ramesh shared the Congress's nominees, while Union Minister Kiren Rijiju emphasized national unity by including Tharoor in a separate delegation to convey India's firm stance against terrorism to key partner nations.

title: 'Don't make Jasprit Bumrah captain': Ravi Shastri drops bombshell
content: Ravi Shastri suggests grooming Shubman Gill or Rishabh Pant as India's next Test captain, following Rohit Sharma's retirement. He advises against burdening Jasprit Bumrah with captaincy due to injury concerns. Shastri emphasizes the importance of age and longevity, highlighting Gill and Pant's leadership experience in the IPL. He dismisses concerns about Gill's overseas performance, backing his potential for future success.

title: 'Act of War'... memes go wild on Chahat Fateh Ali Khan's new patriotic song
content: Pakistani singer Chahat Fateh Ali Khan's new patriotic song, ‚ÄúMeray Watan Meray Chaman,‚Äù celebrating a supposed ceasefire after Operation Sindoor, has gone viral despite his social media ban in India. The song sparked a wave of memes and sarcastic comments on platforms like X, with users humorously comparing it to a nuclear attack or Dhinchak Puja.

title: Russia strikes Ukraine civilian bus, 9 killed
content: A Russian drone strike on a civilian bus in Ukraine's Sumy region resulted in at least nine fatalities and four injuries, according to local authorities. The Sumy regional military administration condemned the attack near Bilopillya as a "cynical attack" on civilians.

title: Trump says he used trade to make peace between India-Pak at brink of 'N-word'
content: Donald Trump claimed that India and Pakistan were dangerously close to a nuclear conflict following the Pahalgam terror attack and India's Operation Sindoor. He stated that the situation escalated rapidly with increasing missile threats, emphasizing the potential for nuclear war.

title: 'Insensitive' and..: Govt sends notice to Amazon, Flipkart for selling Pak flags
content: The CCPA has issued notices to e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart for selling Pakistani national flags and merchandise, deemed insensitive and a violation of national sentiment. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi directed the platforms to immediately remove such listings and adhere to national laws.

title: Watch: Humans swimming with sharks at Israeli beach causes concern
content: Off the coast of Hadera, Israel, a fatal shark attack, the first of its kind in the region, has ignited safety concerns. Dusky and Sandbar sharks, drawn to the warm waters near a power station, gather annually, attracting onlookers.

title: Dalit girl found hanging from tree in UP; family alleges murder by cousin, his friends
content: A 17-year-old Dalit girl was found dead, hanging from a tree in Mainpuri district after she went missing on her way to school. Her family has alleged murder, accusing her cousin and his friends. Police have detained two individuals for questioning and are awaiting the autopsy report to determine the cause of death.

title: Teen beaten to death for 'picking mangoes'; mob torches orchard, house in Bengal
content: Sheikh Farhad Mondal, an orchard owner, was arrested for allegedly killing Sudipto Pandit. Pandit was suspected of stealing mangoes. The incident occurred in Naihati. Mondal reportedly assaulted Pandit, leading to his death. Following the incident, a mob set fire to Mondal's property in Shibdaspur. Authorities deployed RAF and police to manage the unrest. The situation is now under control.

title: Haryana student held in Kaithal for spying, sharing defence info with Pak
content: Devindera Singh Dhillon is arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistan. Dhillon, a student, is accused of sharing defense installation details. Investigation agencies are analyzing his electronic devices and financial transactions. He reportedly met Pakistani handlers via the Kartarpur corridor. This is the second such arrest in Haryana. Earlier, Nauman Ilahi was arrested on similar charges of sharing information with Pakistan.

title: Gujarat horror: Businessman chopped into pieces, stuffed into two bags by employee
content: Chandrabhan Dubey, a security agency owner, was found murdered and his body was discovered in two bags in Surat's Althan area. Police investigations revealed that Rashid Ansari, Dubey's employee, allegedly kidnapped and killed him for a ransom of Rs 1 crore.

title: Op Sindoor briefing: 7 MPs to lead all-party delegations to US, UK, Japan
content: Following Operation Sindoor, India is dispatching all-party parliamentary delegations to key global capitals to present a united front against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. Led by senior MPs, these delegations will raise awareness about cross-border terrorism and explain India's rationale behind the strikes. The initiative aims to showcase India‚Äôs bipartisan resolve and zero-tolerance approach to terrorism on international platforms.

title: How India is preventing entry of Pakistan goods from Gulf countries
content: Following the Pahalgam terrorist incident, India has intensified scrutiny of imports from the UAE, Iran, and other Gulf nations to prevent Pakistani goods from entering indirectly. A complete ban on Pakistani goods is now in effect, with strict verification of import labels and origin criteria.

title: JNU asks 232 final year students to vacate hostel rooms by May 31, triggers concern
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has issued eviction notices to 232 final-year students, requiring them to vacate hostel rooms by May 31, raising concerns about thesis submissions and final exams.

title: 'India is elated and proud': PM Modi lauds Neeraj on breaching 90m mark
content: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Doha Diamond League 2025, becoming the first Indian to breach the 90-meter mark with a 90.23m throw. Despite this personal best, he secured second place, with Germany's Julian Weber winning at 91.06m. PM Narendra Modi lauded Chopra's achievement as a moment of national pride, acknowledging his dedication.

title: Air India lobbies govt to stop IndiGo lease with Turkish Airlines
content: Air India is urging Indian authorities to block IndiGo's leasing agreement with Turkish Airlines, citing business disadvantages and security concerns related to Turkey's stance on Pakistan.

title: NIA arrests two ISIS sleeper cell fugitives at Mumbai airport in 2023 IED Case
content: NIA apprehended two ISIS fugitives, Abdullah Faiyaz Shaikh and Talha Khan, at Mumbai airport upon their return from Jakarta. They were wanted in connection with a 2023 Pune IED case. The suspects, who had evaded capture for two years, are accused of plotting to destabilize India and establish Islamic rule, having assembled and tested IEDs in Pune.

title: 'Dear cricket will ... ': Irfan Pathan's post for Karun Nair sparks buzz
content: Karun Nair's impressive Ranji Trophy performance has earned him a spot in the India ‚ÄòA‚Äô squad for the England tour, reigniting hopes for a national team comeback. Alongside Nair, Abhimanyu Easwaran will lead a team featuring experienced players and promising uncapped talents.

title: Money Heist: When cash ‚Äòrained‚Äô at UP dhaba after thief tried to snatch bizman‚Äôs bag
content: Cash rained down at Jaiswal Dhaba on the Prayagraj-Kanpur highway. A thief tried to steal businessman Bhavesh Kumar Barot's bag. The bag burst open, scattering Rs 5.65 lakh. People initially grabbed the cash. Police and dhaba staff appealed for its return. Everyone returned the money. Police filed a case against the thief. Barot thanked everyone for their honesty.

title: Govt: Indus Waters Treaty will be on hold till Pakistan totally stops terror export
content: India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty. The Jal Shakti ministry informed the cabinet secretary. The treaty will remain inactive. This will continue until Pakistan stops supporting cross-border terrorism. Pakistan has requested India to reconsider the treaty. They cited the dependence of millions on the water regulated by it. The decision follows a terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Is Trump administration planning to move 1 million Palestinians to Libya?
content: Reports surfaced that the Trump administration explored a plan to relocate up to 1 million Palestinians from Gaza to Libya, potentially using unfrozen Libyan funds as compensation. However, the State Department refuted these claims, deeming the situation in Libya unsuitable.

title: Rohit Sharma stand: MCA hands first ticket to former Test captain
content: Rohit Sharma, visibly emotional, honoured his parents at Wankhede Stadium during the unveiling of a stand named after him on Friday. He expressed gratitude for their sacrifices, acknowledging their role in his cricketing journey. Alongside Sharma, Ajit Wadekar and Sharad Pawar were also recognised.

title: 'Talent vacuum in BJP': Cong on Tharoor leading delegation to expose Pak's terrorism
content: The Congress party lauded the Centre's decision to appoint Shashi Tharoor to lead a delegation of MPs to expose Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on international platforms, citing a perceived "talent vacuum" within the BJP.

title: Nagpur woman on vacation crossed into Pakistan ‚Äòto meet pastor she met online‚Äô
content: Sunita, a 43-year-old Nagpur woman, has crossed the Line of Control into Pakistan, baffling Indian security agencies. Driven by a desire to meet a Pakistani pastor she met online, this was her third attempt to cross the border. She left her son in Kargil before crossing over and is now believed to be in Pakistani custody.

title: Watch: In a first, Pakistan PM admits India hit Nur Khan Airbase
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Indian ballistic missiles struck Nur Khan Airbase and other locations, prompting a late-night call from the Army Chief. India initiated Operation Sindoor following a terror attack, targeting terror infrastructure and militants. Hostilities ceased on May 10 after retaliatory actions and coordinated attacks on Pakistani airbases.

title: ‚ÄòTo easy lol‚Äô: 10 inmates use blankets to escape through hole in New Orleans jail
content: In a brazen jailbreak, ten inmates escaped the Orleans Justice Center in New Orleans after exploiting a hole behind a toilet. The absence of a guard and suspected insider assistance facilitated the escape. Two fugitives have been apprehended, while eight remain at large, considered armed and dangerous. Authorities are investigating security failures and urging public vigilance as the search intensifies.

title: World Hypertension Day 2025: All about the DASH diet to keep stress at bay
content: World Hypertension Day, observed on May 17th, raises awareness about high blood pressure and its consequences. Managing hypertension involves lifestyle changes like the DASH diet, which emphasizes fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and low-fat dairy while limiting sodium and unhealthy fats. This diet effectively lowers blood pressure, reduces heart disease risk, and improves overall health.

title: 'Teachers overburdened': 18 govt schools in Haryana record zero passes in 12th boards
content: Following the declaration of class 12 board exam results, eighteen government schools in Haryana have come under scrutiny due to a zero percent pass rate. These schools are among 100 poorly performing institutions that have overshadowed the state's overall pass percentage.

title: Blow to Trump? Moody's strips US of top credit rating
content: Moody's Ratings has lowered the United States government's credit rating. This is due to concerns about increasing government debt. The downgrade creates problems for President Trump.

title: Supreme Court irked by repeated PILs to stop Rohingya deportation
content: The Supreme Court rebuked repeated PIL attempts to halt the alleged deportation of Rohingya Muslims, emphasizing that previous relief was denied on May 8. Senior Advocate Colin Gonsalves' plea, citing the deportation of 28 Rohingyas and threats to their lives in Myanmar, was met with skepticism due to lack of verifiable evidence.

title: King Charles III is now richer than Queen Elizabeth II: But how did this happen?
content: King Charles III's personal wealth has surged to an estimated ¬£640 million, surpassing that of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, due to inherited investments and estates. This increase places him on par with Rishi Sunak and Akshata Murty, despite their wealth slightly decreasing.

title: 'I‚Äôm in no rush': Trump says India willing to cut 100% tariffs for US
content: President Trump claimed India offered to eliminate all tariffs for the U.S., but he's in no rush to finalize a trade deal. This follows India's aim to secure an agreement during a tariff suspension period. Bilateral trade between the two nations reached $129 billion in 2024, with India holding a $45.7 billion surplus.

title: '$40,000 vs $41 mn': Trump praises Iranian drones for being 'good, fast and deadly'
content: Donald Trump praised Iranian drone technology for its affordability and effectiveness, contrasting its low cost with the high prices quoted by US defense manufacturers. He highlighted the deadly impact of drones in modern warfare, referencing their use in conflicts like the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: 'I wanted to play ... ': Rohit Sharma's emotional confession
content: Rohit Sharma was overcome with emotion at Wankhede Stadium as a stand was unveiled in his name, a tribute to his illustrious career. He expressed gratitude to his parents for their sacrifices and shared the honor with legends Ajit Wadekar and Sharad Pawar. Ritika Sajdeh, Rohit's wife, stood beside him, smiling proudly as she soaked in the emotional moment.

title: Mumbai's Atal Setu: 28-year-old driving BMW dies after crashing into dumper
content: In a tragic incident early Friday, Punit Singh Majra, 28, died after crashing his rented BMW X1 into a dumper on the Atal Setu in Mumbai. Driving at a speed of 180 kmph, Majra lost control of the vehicle. Police extracted his body from the wreckage and transported him to a hospital, where he was declared dead.

title: UP nursery student dies after being slapped for crying
content: In Prayagraj, a three-and-a-half-year-old nursery student tragically died after allegedly being slapped by teachers at his private school. Police have registered an FIR against the teachers for culpable homicide, following allegations of physical and emotional distress inflicted upon the child.

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Knicks finish off Celtics as fans rejoice in NYC
content: The Knicks reached the Eastern Conference finals for the first time in 25 years and ended the one-year NBA title reign of the Celtics with astonishing ease, rolling to a 119-81 victory in Game 6 on Friday night.

title: Sources: Purdy, 49ers reach 5-year, $265M deal
content: Brock Purdy, the last pick in the 2022 NFL draft who has gone on to become a Pro Bowler, is finalizing a 5-year, $265M deal with the 49ers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Brown: Loss to Knicks 'feels like death,' but life after
content: After a 38-point drubbing by the Knicks in Game 6 ended the Celtics' reign as NBA champions, Jaylen Brown acknowledged, "Finishing in May feels weird, it's definitely not something we were prepared for."

title: Report: Rory driver ruled nonconforming at PGA
content: Rory McIlroy was forced to use a backup driver in the PGA Championship when his regular driver was tested and deemed to be nonconforming after he arrived at Quail Hollow, according to a report on SiriusXM PGA Tour Radio on Friday.

title: Plum meets hype with record 37 in Sparks debut
content: Kelsey Plum broke the WNBA record for most points in a season opener, scoring 37 in her Sparks debut Friday night in an 84-67 win over the Valkyries.

title: Mets' Soto listens to boos, tips hat in Bronx return
content: Juan Soto's return to Yankee Stadium in a Mets uniform Friday night went just about as he expected: with loud, relentless boos and chants from a scorned fanbase still offended by his offseason choice.

title: Collier pours in 34 as Lynx spoil Bueckers' debut
content: Napheesa Collier scored 34 points to outshine the WNBA debut of Paige Bueckers, who had 10 points, in the Minnesota Lynx's 99-84 win over the Dallas Wings on Friday night.

title: Sources: Nuggets' Gordon in doubt for Game 7
content: Nuggets forward Aaron Gordon is in doubt for Sunday's Game 7 after being diagnosed with a strained left hamstring, sources told ESPN.

title: üì∑ Bueckers leads WNBA's best dressed for debut
content: Before the WNBA's best take the floor, they dazzled the pregame tunnel with their opening-night outfits.

title: Will Aaron Judge hit .400? Blast 60 home runs? Our predictions based on his incredible start
content: The Yankees' superstar outfielder is outdoing even himself so far. Will he go over or under his current pace?

title: 49ers QB Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant: New contract comes with pressure to lead, win
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Tiering 25 rookie running backs by expected role: Lead backs, committee options and depth backups
content: Which rookie RBs will make noise in 2025? We grouped 25 draft picks by expected Year 1 role, from Ashton Jeanty to Jacory Croskey-Merritt.

title: Chelsea's struggles without Jackson make Champions League qualification uncertain
content: Chelsea barely beat Man United, but serious questions linger about whether the Blues can clinch a Champions League spot as Nicolas Jackson remains out.

title: Sources: Marsch, Blackmon in talks for Canada NT
content: Canada men's national team manager Jesse Marsch has initiated discussions with Vancouver Whitecaps defender Tristan Blackmon about the possibility of him representing Canada, sources told ESPN.

title: Fastest to 25: Chawinga sets NWSL scoring record
content: Temwa Chawinga's goal on Friday night secured a 1-0 win for the Kansas City Current against the Orlando Pride, making her the quickest player in NWSL history to reach 25 goals.

title: Maresca: Stop judging Chelsea by past glories
content: Enzo Maresca has warned onlookers not to judge Chelsea against their past glory days and urged supporters to "trust" him after taking a significant step towards Champions League qualification.

title: Pep slams Prem scheduling: 9 years fighting this
content: Pep Guardiola has hit out at the Premier League over the scheduling of Manchester City's fixture against Bournemouth.

title: Salah: Don't boo TAA in final Liverpool games
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has called for fans not to boo teammate Trent Alexander-Arnold in the club's remaining games this season.

title: Arteta: Havertz transformed body during injury
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Kai Havertz has undergone a "transformation in his body" while being injured and claimed he "destroyed all the metrics we had in the gym for the last 10 years."

title: NWSL: Game should've stopped after King collapse
content: The National Women's Soccer League said that it would abandon future games that have life-threatening emergencies to players.

title: Galaxy extend coach despite record winless start
content: Head coach Greg Vanney has been given a multi-year contract extension by the defending MLS Cup champion LA Galaxy despite their historic 13-game winless skid to start the new season.

title: Every Premier League team reranked: Spurs, Forest plummet; Man United can't bounce back
content: It's time to rank all 20 teams in the Premier League one final time! Did Man United or Man City bounce back? Could Forest and Tottenham hang on?

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: FA Cup win won't save Man City, but it can kick-start their rebuild
content: Manchester City have had their fair share of struggles this season, but a win over Crystal Palace in the FA Cup final could spark their return to the top of English and European soccer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool and Chelsea to challenge Inter for David
content: Clubs such as Chelsea, Liverpool and Barcelona could challenge Inter Milan for Jonathan David. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Amid growing pains at Ferrari, will Hamilton win in F1 again?
content: Lewis Hamilton is not accustomed to losing, but he's been doing a lot of it. Will that ever change at Ferrari?

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar Draws Parallel Between Op Sindoor And Osama Bin Laden's Killing
content: Describing attacks on nine terror sites in Pakistan as the "deepest-ever cross-border strike" by India, the vice president recalled the September 11, 2001 terror attacks in the United States.

title: BJP's "Insecurity, Jealousy" Jibe At Congress Over Shashi Tharoor
content: While praising Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's international credentials and oratory skills, the BJP raised questions about Mr Tharoor's position within his own party.

title: As Israel's Launches Op 'Gideon's Chariots', How It Plans To 'Conquer' Gaza
content: Gaza's civil defense agency reported 100 fatalities on Friday due to Israeli strikes, while the IDF claims to have struck over 150 terror targets in the Gaza Strip within 24 hours.

title: Donald Trump Reshapes US Mideast Policy. Can Deals Work Instead?
content: Trump vowed during his swing through Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates that there would be no more "lectures on how to live", saying the region had achieved a "modern miracle the Arabian way."

title: She Was 3 Days Old When A Woman Found Her On Road. At 13, She Killed Her
content: She was adopted as a newborn by a woman who found her abandoned on the roadside in Odisha when she was just three years old. She grew up and killed her adoptive mother with the help of two men.

title: On Camera, Bengaluru Techie Run Over After Dispute Over Cigarette
content: The stranger asked the software professional to fetch a cigarette for him and allegedly rammed his car into his motorcycle after he refused.

title: Who Is Raj Mishra, UP Farmer's Son Elected Mayor Of Market Town In UK
content: Raj Mishra went on to become the fifth mayor of the town at an Annual Town Council Meeting on Tuesday, May 13.

title: 2 Terrorists, Linked To 2023 Pune Terror Conspiracy, Arrested In Mumbai
content: The anti-terror agency said the case pertains to a larger conspiracy by ten individuals, including the two recently arrested, to carry out terrorist activities and wage war against the Government of India.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Trial: Takeaways From First Week Of Testimony
content: Sean 'Diddy' Combs is facing charges of sex trafficking and leading an illegal sex ring that enforced power with crimes including arson and bribery.

title: Rescuers Say 100 Dead As Israel Launches Fresh Gaza Offensive
content: The Israeli military said it had launched "extensive strikes" as part of a fresh offensive in Gaza, after rescuers reported 100 people killed in the besieged Palestinian territory.

title: Man Chops Wife Into Pieces, Throws Body Parts Across 10 Km In UP
content: The accused, identified as Saifuddin, and his wife, Sabina, were on their way to Lucknow earlier this week when he committed the crime.

title: Manhunt In US Tourist Hub New Orleans After 10 Escape Jail
content: Ten prisoners escaped a New Orleans jail after breaking through a wall behind a toilet, law enforcement said, slipping away without being detected.

title: In Mexico, First Outrage, Then Victim-Blaming Over Murdered TikTok Influencer
content: The influencer seems to be among many Mexican women whose murder briefly shocks the conscience only to recede into the background until the next gruesome crime happens.

title: Congress Gave 4 Names For Global Outreach, Shashi Tharoor Not One Of Them
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor will lead a key all-party delegation overseas, despite not featuring in his party's own shortlist of nominees for the task.

title: Japan Committed To Moon Missions As Trump Cuts NASA Budget: JAXA Chief
content: Japan is ready to support the United States' lower-cost lunar missions, its space agency chief said, after the US administration proposed a $6 billion cut to NASA's budget.

title: "I Will Not Be Found Wanting When...": Shashi Tharoor On Getting Key Role
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, in a post on X, said that when national interest is involved, he would "not be found wanting".

title: Haryana Student Arrested For Spying, Allegedly Shared Key Info With Pakistan
content: A college student was arrested from Haryana's Kaithal on charges of spying and passing on sensitive information to Pakistan.

title: Shashi Tharoor's "Painful" Post After Meeting Families Of Accident Victims
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor met the families of four men who were killed in a road accident in Thiruvananthapuram last week.

title: Why Moving iPhone Manufacturing From Asia To US Is Not Easy
content: US President Donald Trump recently ran into a "little problem" with Tim Cook, after his company Apple said it would be moving a big chunk of its iPhone production for the US market from China to India.

title: When Kapil Sibal Asked Justice Bela Trivedi If She Had "Some Empathy"
content: Justice Bela M Trivedi demitted office on Friday after serving over three and a half years on the Supreme Court of India. Tributes poured in on her last day in court, including a recount of an older case from senior lawyer Kapil Sibal.

title: How Hansi Flick won the LaLiga title and took Barcelona back to the top
content: barca beat spanish rivals Espanyol 2-0 to clinch the laLiga title . they had already won the Supercopa de Espaa and the Copa del Rey . coach Hansi Flick inherits a team that had not won a trophy in two of the previous campaigns .

title: 'She's a folk hero in our sport': How NiJaree Canady became college softball's first million-dollar player
content: nijaree canady landed the richest softball NIL deal ever . she had won just 49% of its games and 31% of its league games since the advent of the Big 12 . her new home would be on the arid plains of west Texas at a school .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Knicks' Game 6 knockout gives New York conference finals berth
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 2-0 in the Eastern and Western Conference semifinals . the playoffs are the second round of the 2025 playoffs for the first time since 2000 . it's the largest playoff win in franchise history for the Knicks in history .

title: Thibs, Brunson carryovers from last time Knicks were in the Eastern Conference finals
content: the new york Knicks are in the Eastern Conference finals for just the second time this century . the knicks defeated the Boston Celtics in Game 6 on friday, winning the series 4-2 . since the 1999-2000 season, the last time they were in the conference finals, they have had three chances to reach that stage again .

title: Potential upsets? Early favorites? We preview the 2025 softball regionals
content: the Oklahoma Sooners begin their quest for a fifth straight ring as the regionals begin on friday . eight of the overall top 10 seeds are from the conference . some of the best pitchers are playing for teams like Texas Tech (NiJaree Canady), Arizona State (Kenzie Brown).

content: baseball was invented in the city nearly 4,500 years ago . he writes in his book "Baseball in the Garden of Eden" he is regarded as one of the greatest military strategists and warrior pharaohs of all time .

title: Handing out grades for every full-time Cup driver: From four A's to a painful F
content: NASCAR's all-Star race festivities are in North Wilkesboro, North Carolina this weekend . a weighted combination of key performance indicators was used to compare drivers on an even scale . the formula included a variety of components, each standardized in order of importance . it's a chance to take stock of what has happened in the 2025 season so far .

content: Leader of Opposition in Andhra Pradesh Legislative Council Botcha Satyanarayana Satyanarayana said CM Chandrababu Naidu was resorting to vindictive politics and false cases were booked

content: Sikkim CM expresses gratitude for love and support on 50th Statehood Day celebration, reflecting shared identity and pride

title: Teen girl, two friends arrested for killing woman who raised her, in Odisha
content: The motive was allegedly the mother‚Äôs opposition to the adopted daughter‚Äôs relationship with the two young men and to gain control of her property

title: Corruption case takes dramatic turn as VACB names ED Kochi unit official as key accused in remand report
content: S. Sasidharan, Ernakulam VACB Superintendent, says ED official arraigned as accused based on businessman‚Äôs statement. But the official‚Äôs role remains to be verified and hence he has not been arrested yet

title: Search operation launched in J&K's Samba
content: A joint team of police and paramilitary forces cordoned off Nangal, Chilladanga, Goran and adjoining forests early morning on May 17 for a thorough search operation, which is underway.

title: IUML inducts two women in national leadership, a first in its over 75-year history
content: Welcoming the development, IUML Rajya Sabha MP Abdul Wahab said it was a "necessary" move as there were no women in its national leadership

title: Countdown for the launch of PSLV-C61 mission commences
content: ISRO commences 22-hour countdown for Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle-C61 launch carrying Earth Observation Satellite (EOS-09) satellite for earth imaging on May 18

title: A. Pradeep Kumar appointed private secretary to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: A State committee member of CPI(M) and former MLA, Pradeep Kumar fills the post left vacant by his predecessor, K.K. Ragesh, who CPI(M) appointed as party‚Äôs district secretary in Kannur

title: Protest against desecration of holy books in Belagavi
content: A large number of people gathered in front of the Anjuman ground near Kittur Rani Channamma Circle in Belagavi

title: Hyderabad | Inspect problematic water logging areas: GHMC commissioner
content: Additional Commissioner of Police, Traffic, Joel Davis highlighted need for pro-active clearance of fallen trees and deployment of large cranes to handle vehicle breakdowns

title: SIA conducts raids at multiple places in Kashmir
content: Jammu and Kashmir Police conduct raids in multiple locations to crackdown on terror-related activities in the valley

title: Couple brutally attacked in Madanapalle
content: The couple, Errappa (30) and Shyamala (26), were intercepted by the assailants when they were returning home after attending an errand in Madanapalle.

title: Karnataka government will distribute one lakh title deeds at Sadhana Samavesha in Hosapete, says Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar
content: Residents of tandas, hattis, hadis and camps will get property titles, Vijayanagara will be declared a ‚ÄòPodi Mukta‚Äô district during the rally

title: When national interest is involved, will not be found wanting: Tharoor says on being named part of multi-party delegation for diplomatic outreach
content: Government announced that it will send seven all-party delegations to key partner countries, including members of the U.N. Security Council, later this month to convey India's message of zero tolerance against terrorism

title: Assistant professor who raised allegations against Periyar University placed under suspension
content: With two days left for the end of the extended tenure of Periyar University Vice-Chancellor R. Jagannathan, this action has come under severe criticism

title: Four killed, over 15 injured in road accident on Karur-Salem highway
content: According to police sources, a private luxury bus travelling from Salem to Karur rammed a tractor before climbing onto the central median. The bus then veered off and collided head-on with a tourist van coming from the opposite direction, resulting in a pile-up.

title: DVAC conducts searches at ex-AIADMK Minister Sevur Ramachandran‚Äôs houses in Tiruvannamalai
content: Mr. Ramachandran had served as Minister for HR&CE during the previous AIADMK regime; sources said the searches were being carried out based on complaints that he had amassed assets in excess of his income¬†

title: Shashi Tharoor, Supriya Sule among MPs leading multi-party delegations for¬†diplomatic outreach on India-Pakistan conflict
content: The Government will send seven all-party delegations to convey India‚Äôs zero-tolerance message against terrorism to key partner countries

title: Seven militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces seize four firearms, including two bolt-action single-barrel rifles, one .22 bolt-action rifle, and one 9 mm pistol with a magazine, were seized from Senapati district of Manipur.

title: Patronage from government needed for keeping folk arts alive
content: Founder of Gidugu Ramamurthy Telugu Bhasha and Janapada Kalapeetham urges government to allow each major temple to adopt at least one folk art form so that artistes will be able to perform frequently and pass on their skills to the next generation

title: Folk art forms, once Andhra‚Äôs signature, fading into oblivion
content: Art forms such as Tholu Bommalata, Chekka Bhajana, Gangireddu Aata, Dasarulu, Samu Garadi, Karrasamu, Jamukula Pata and Yakshaganam are on the verge of extinction in the State, with little patronage from society and government

title: AP Liquor Scam: SIT arrests former Secretary to CM Dhanunjaya Reddy, OSD Krishna Mohan Reddy
content: Police grilled the duo for about ten hours and announced their arrest on Friday, and the accused would be likely to be produced in the ACB Special Court

title: The Boston Celtics and the price of history
content: the extended Boston Celtics franchise gathered in a theater to celebrate another championship . it was just a few blocks from the Brahmin church where Bob Cousy eulogized John Havlicek, and from the four-star hotel where Red Auerbach lived . the party was a high table meeting of those witnesses and high priests .

title: Mumbai airport ropes in Indo Thai Airport Services for ground handling works
content: ‚ÄúAll ground handling equipment currently owned by Celebi NAS will be leased by Indo Thai Airport Services, in order to maintain continuity of service,‚Äù the statement by Mumbai International Airport Limited said

title: Karnataka seeks electric buses under PM E-Drive; Union Minister Kumaraswamy assures support
content: Karnataka Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy submitted the proposal to the Ministry of Heavy Industries, citing the growing need to strengthen public transport in major cities across the state.

title: Vijay Shah remark row: Congress protests outside Raj Bhavan demanding dismissal of M.P. Minister
content: The Congress questions BJP‚Äôs ‚Äòinaction‚Äô against its Minister Vijay Shah and also State Deputy CM Jagdish Devda for his ‚ÄòForces bowing down to Modi‚Äô remarks

title: Maharashtra IPS transfers-promotions: Arti Singh posted as Mumbai‚Äôs first intelligence Joint CP
content: The sixth post of joint commissioner in the metropolis‚Äô force was created recently by the State Government to boost intelligence gathering

title: IWT to remain suspended until Pakistan abjures support for cross-border terror: Jal Shakti ministry
content: According to sources, Pakistan's Water Resources Secretary Syed Ali Murtaza had expressed his government's readiness to discuss specific objections raised by New Delhi

title: Restore farmers‚Äô confidence by ensuring MSP for produce, A.P. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells officials
content: Traders must commence procurement of tobacco at remunerative prices immediately, he says, adding that a special model be developed for cocoa cultivation and marketing; the Chief Minister directed officials to purchase remaining paddy from farmers and encourage them to cultivate fine (sanna) varieties

title: KTR‚Äôs hypocrisy on women‚Äôs dignity is laughable: Congress MP
content: Bhongir MP Chamala Kiran Reddy said the symbolic gesture of some volunteers helping the Miss World contestants wipe their feet was being blown out of proportion by the BRS

title: India will no longer tolerate terrorist attacks, says CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Speaking at the Tiranga Yatra on the arterial M.G. Road here on Friday, Mr. Naidu said the manner in which India built its weaponry was commendable

title: Tiranga rally taken out in Tirupati to celebrate success of Operation Sindoor
content: Students, traders, ex-servicemen, industrialists, educationists, community leaders and leaders from BJP, TDP and Jana Sena Party take part in rally

title: U.P. govt to soon launch new health policy, eyes private investment
content: Under the new policy, 200-bed Super-Specialty Hospitals will be established in municipal corporations and 57 district headquarters

title: Sanjay Raut‚Äôs book refers to BJP bigwigs as ‚Äòingrates,‚Äô triggering a political row
content: He claimed that Balasaheb Thackeray,¬†and Sharad Pawar helped Mr. Modi and Mr. Shah when they faced political and legal troubles, yet the two were ungrateful

title: Opposition united only by hatred of PM Modi, says Kerala BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: ‚ÄòThe fact that INDI alliance represents not even one idea for bettering lives, for bettering India, has been known for several years now‚Äô, says the BJP leader

title: Stopping conflict a ‚Äòbig success‚Äô, level of anger was not a good thing: Trump
content: Mr. Trump has been continuously claiming that the U.S. brokered the ‚Äòceasefire‚Äô between New Delhi and Islamabad but the Indian govt. has maintained that the DGMOs of the two countries arrived at an understanding to stop the conflict

title: When home is near the border
content: After days of living through heightened uncertainty following the targeting of civilians by Pakistan, villagers along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab are hoping that peace holds and their lives return to normalcy, reports Ishita Mishra

title: Haryana‚Äôs Nuh adopts sports-driven approach to combat drug abuse
content: Large turnout at sports events provides opportunity for organisers and officials to address various health and social issues, including rising tuberculosis cases, high dropout rates, and drug addiction

title: The ex-DRDO scientist who spent 34 years of his career building ‚ÄòAkash‚Äô missile system
content: Gaddamanugu Chandramouli was part of the maiden team of three members, when noted scientist Prahalad Rama Rao was entrusted with making the Akash missile system by former President A.P. J. Abdul Kalam

title: Telangana is a medical tourism hub drawing over one lakh visitors annually: Health Secretary
content: The State‚Äôs appeal is now expanding further to Southeast Asia and Europe, said Telangana Health Secretary Christina Z. Chongthu

title: Aurobindo Pharma arm launches leadership programme at IMTH¬†
content: A six-month programme, the CLP aims to transform promising professionals into dynamic leaders by equipping them with skills in managing self, teams, business and change

title: Miss World contestants experience Telangana‚Äôs blend of eco-tourism and heritage
content: The day‚Äôs itinerary included visits to the Pillalamarri banyan tree in Mahabubnagar to eco-tourism haven of Experium Eco Park near Hyderabad

title: Kollam police books Kesari editor N.R. Madhu on charges of creating enmity between communities
content: Mr. Madhu had allegedly portrayed rapper Vedan, who hails from the Dalit community, as a ‚Äúdisreputable character‚Äù who makes a mockery of art and injects caste venom in society¬†

title: India to do whatever is necessary to build ties with Afghanistan: officials
content: New Delhi to do ‚Äòwhatever is necessary‚Äô to bolster relations, officials said after Minister S. Jaishankar talks with his Afghan counterpart; Centre considering aid for Afghans expelled by Pakistan.

title: SC rules ISKCON-Bangalore owner of Hare Krishna hill temple
content: The apex court found the High Court‚Äôs conclusion that ISKCON-Mumbai owned the temple through its branch in Bangalore ‚Äúcompletely erroneous‚Äù and ‚Äúcontrary to the documentary evidence‚Äù

title: Use drones to keep vigil on vulnerable places, Krishna SP tells personnel
content: Gangadhar Rao directs Station House Officers to address complaints received through Public Grievance Redressal System on a priority basis

title:
Amit Shah inaugurates revamped multi-agency network built
at ‚Çπ500 cr. to fight terrorism
content: As many as 28 organisations, including the Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), armed forces and State police, are part of the platform and various security agencies share real time intelligence inputs on MAC

title: U.K. determined to play role in improving India-Pakistan ties, fighting terror: Lammy
content: The U.K. Foreign Secretary strongly condemns terrorism and reminds of close ties that India and Pakistan enjoy with his country

title: Heavy rain, thunderstorm likely at some places in A.P. in next four days
content: Masada in Hukumpeta mandal of Alluri Sitharama Raju district and Ankampalle in Beluguppa mandal of Anantapur district recorded the highest rainfall of 18.5 mm on Friday

title: Nagpur woman goes missing in village along LoC in Kargil
content: Though her whereabouts were not known yet, police officials said that the woman had tried to cross over to Pakistan near Amritsar border in Punjab in March this year.

title: Murshidabad violence victims anxious about safety, State must ensure protection: Calcutta HC
content: The court notes that the committee report points to vandalism and massacre as ‚Äòpremeditated and an organised crime‚Äô; the court added that the victims‚Äô demand for a permanent camp of Central forces shall be considered

title: BJP, BSP condemn SP leader Ram Gopal Yadav‚Äôs comments on Air Force officer Vyomika Singh
content: Mr. Yadav had sparked a controversy when he said Col. Sofiya Qureshi was being targeted by a BJP Minister as she is a Muslim, but Wg Cdr. Singh was spared thinking she was Rajput.

title: Opposition agrees to join govt.‚Äôs diplomatic outreach on India-Pakistan conflict
content: Centre to send eight delegations to Europe, West Asia and Africa and explain India‚Äôs stand on the conflict with Pakistan; Rijiju dials senior leaders from Congress, CPI(M), DMK, AIMIM and other parties

title: WB govt. Staff hail court order directing State to pay 25% DA arrears
content: The decision will benefit 12 lakh employees and pensioners and is likely to cost ‚Çπ10,000 crore. Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari demanded Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee‚Äôs resignation over the matter

title: Handloom and Textiles tie up with SPA to modernise Lepakshi showrooms across AP
content: New showrooms will reflect the Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs rich history, handicrafts, handlooms and the essence of Telugu culture; the designs will be developed in collaboration with SPA (Vijayawada)

title: NIA conducts searches at 15 locations linked to Babbar Khalsa International in Punjab
content: The searches were carried out in Gurdaspur, Batala, Amritsar, and Kapurthala districts leading to the seizure of various incriminating materials, including mobiles/digital devices and documents

title: People of J&K want peace, not war: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: Delivering a customary sermon at the Jama masjid in Srinagar, the Mirwaiz highlighted the deaths of twins in Poonch in the recent military confrontation between India and Pakistan in J&K

title: Supreme Court‚Äôs three-month timeline in Tamil Nadu Governor verdict was adopted from Centre‚Äôs own guidelines
content: The Supreme Court‚Äôs April 8 judgment made it clear that it was merely adopting guidelines issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs

title: What to watch heading into PGA Championship weekend
content: the second round of the PGA Championship is in the books . the leaderboard remained one of the most eclectic in recent memory . world no. 1 Scottie Scheffler shoots 3 under and puts himself in prime position .

title: 2025 WNBA predictions: Staff picks to win title, MVP, more
content: the new york Liberty beat the Minnesota Lynx 67-62 in the deciding game 5 of the 2024 WNBA Finals . the Liberty and the Lyndx are the front-runners to reach the 2025 . there are big challenges, including the two-time champion Las Vegas Aces and the team that seems to have the most preseason buzz .
